results.title: Just do it
results.creator_credit: La Verite Films, Kim Snow, Jenny Livingston and Sarah Hatherley
results.brief_description: Two thirty-something women, Alice, an aspiring filmmaker, and Sandy, a student with a messy love life, meet regularly to walk around the domain. As they walk they talk about the state of their lives, yet, due especially to Sandy’s self-obsession and insensitivity, their conversations are less dialogues than therapeutic monologues. The tables are turned when Sandy’s unsympathetic response to her friend’s creative struggles, and her dismissive remark to ‘just do it’ have an unexpected outcome. Cast: Alison Whyte, Alice Garner.

results.title: Just desserts
results.creator_credit: Monica Pellizzari and NRG Films Australia
results.brief_description: This delicious comedy about an Italo-Australian girl’s sexual awakening and her love for her mama’s cooking is written, produced and directed by Monica Pellizzari. Through the use of a split screen which separates the food from the experience, issues such as menstruation, masturbation, lesbianism and virginity are explored, against a backdrop of broth, venetian fritters, polenta, dumplings and pizza. Cast includes Dina Panozzo and Anne-Louise Lambert.

results.title: Just call me Kade [NTSC]
results.brief_description: This documentary focuses on Kade Farlow Collins a teenage FTM (female to male transgendered person) residing in Tucson, Arizona. At the age of fourteen Kade (then Kate), supported by her family, began the process of transitioning from female to male. Drawing on his personal narrative the film follows Kade’s transition over a two year period. Friends and family candidly express their feelings about the transition, the changes in Kade and the impact on everyone involved. A moving story of some of the difficulties facing transgendered youth, as well as a portrayal of acceptance and understanding.

results.title: Just business
results.brief_description:
A drama of revenge and retribution demonstrating high production values to create a corporate world of greed and indifference. Controlled camera work, lighting and slick editing combine with assured direction of the actors to create tension as this disturbing tale reaches its climax.
WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SCENES THAT MAY DISTURB SOME VIEWERS

results.title: Just Australian trains
results.brief_description: A compilation of seven films featuring the trains of Australia - from our past to present day. This will appeal to the railway enthusiasts, and to those who aren’t railway buffs it may explain some of the railway’s history and mystique.

results.title: Just Australian Planes
results.brief_description: Narrated by Aden Wickes, Senior Check Captain with Qantas, this film contains extraordinary rare footage of different kinds of aeroplanes, past and present, and their respective pilots. It charts a unique aeronautical journey in time, from the beginnings of the RAAF to the more fanciful, high tech aircraft of today.

results.brief_description: Drawing inspiration from Pixar’s Luxo the lamp, this short student digital animation is about a young unicycle robot, who just wants to be friends.

group_siblings.title: A Life before
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jamie MacDowell, Jim Curtis and Nick Ball

results.title: Just another job
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren, ONF | NFB and Pierre Letarte
results.brief_description: This is professional hockey from the inside, an experience of the game that only the aspiring player can know. The film is about Les Nordiques de Quebec, the first truly French-Canadian professional hockey club. Coached at the start by superstar Maurice Richard, it is seen here playing its opening World Hockey Association game at the Quebec Coliseum. Vividly real is the pre-game tension, the on-ice action, where hopes rest on a flying puck, and, for one player at least, a dream realized in the inner office where big contracts are signed.

results.title: Just an idea
results.creator_credit: James Mellor, Central Office of Information, Editorial Film Productions and Guy Blanchard
results.brief_description: The many sources of technical information available to British industry, including research associations, technical libraries, and the constituent organisations of the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research. The film illustrates how the owner of an engineering firm solves a production problem with the help of valuable technical information obtained from these sources.

results.title: Just an accident
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to Psychology”.
Concerned with the experimental investigation of human factors in road accident causation. Considers individual differences in hazard perception, the problem of where the driver pays attention within the visual field, and how the driver deals with a hazard which has been seen.
